title: Lockheed Martin makes a big bet on commercial space and the Moon
summary: "We needed a way to have a compelling commercial services offering."

title: Virgin Orbit seeking expedited bankruptcy sale
summary: Virgin Orbit is proposing a rapid sale of the company or its assets in bankruptcy, hoping to conclude the process before the end of May.

title: Rocket Lab shifts NASA cubesat launches from Virginia to New Zealand
summary: Rocket Lab has shifted a pair of Electron launches of NASA storm-monitoring cubesats from Virginia to New Zealand, avoiding a potential conflict with another launch.

title: China to target asteroid 2019 VL5 for 2025 planetary defense test
summary: China has selected near-Earth object 2019 VL5 for a combined asteroid deflection and observation test to launch 2025.

title: Rocket Lab Sets Launch Dates For TROPICS Launches
summary: On April 10th, Rocket Lab announced the preliminary launch timeline for the two dedicated launches of four NASA’s TROPICS satellites. The two launches are expected to be on May 1st and May 16th 2023, launching from RocketLab’s LC-1A and LC-1B launchpads in New Zealand.

title: Report: U.S. military satellite antennas overdue for upgrades
summary: The ground terminals used to operate U.S. military and intelligence satellites are running out of capacity and in dire need of upgrades, warns a new report from the Government Accountability Office.

title: Preventing sticker shock with transparent pricing
summary:
Within the space sector, long known for opaque pricing, transparency is
gaining traction

title: Connecting the Dots | European space investments get serious
summary: A series of large fundraising deals in Europe since the start of the year is raising hopes that the region could be turning a corner for early-stage space investments. European […]

title: SpaceX’s Starship vehicle is ready to fly, just waiting for a launch license
summary: SpaceX engineers have a million questions about the performance of these vehicles.

title: Canada proposes to develop robotic lunar rover for Artemis
summary: As Canada celebrates its first astronaut to go to the moon, it is starting a new project that could eventually enable a Canadian to walk on the lunar surface.
